Red Tide was in existence long before Global Warming/Climate Change was a coined phrase! Grow up. Read real history.

Algal blooms are common in Florida and along the rest of the Gulf Coast, but they don‚Äôt always get this bad. This one began in 2017 and, over the past few months, has slowly ballooned into a nightmare scenario for residents and business owners ‚Äî not to mention the thousands of animals that have died.
There are several ways human activity can exacerbate a bloom, but the main culprit is allowing nitrogen-rich material such as fertilizer to run off into natural water sources. The same fertilizer that helps sugar cane, tomatoes and corn grow in the Sunshine State feeds algae when it reaches the ocean.
Humans are also playing a role by driving up global temperatures via greenhouse gas emissions. In a letter published by the journal Environmental Science & Technology, researchers at the University of Florida and the University of North Carolina said that ‚Äúclimate change will severely affect our ability to control blooms, and in some cases could make it near impossible.‚Äù
As air and ocean temperatures increase, the environment becomes more hospitable to toxic algal blooms in several ways, according to scientists and the Environmental Protection Agency." - WaPo (2018)

Red Tide has nothing to do with global warming, idiot.

Harmful algae usually bloom during the warm summer season or when water temperatures are warmer than usual. Warmer water due to climate change might favor harmful algae in a number of ways:
Toxic blue-green algae prefer warmer water.
Warmer temperatures prevent water from mixing, allowing algae to grow thicker and faster.
Warmer water is easier for small organisms to move through and allows algae to float to the surface faster.
Algal blooms absorb sunlight, making water even warmer and promoting more blooms. - EPA

I am relieved to see the so called ‚Äúred tide‚Äù has finally received National media attention.  However, the real reason the Gulf Coast is experiencing these massive fish kills is man made. Yes, red tide is naturally occurring, but add man made fertilizers to it and it becomes red tide on steroids. This is caused by run-off from Mosaic Fertilizer, Big Sugar, old septic systems and poor water management. This article fails to mention the health risks to humans from the Cyanobacteria, brevotoxins and microcystins red tide creates. For years this has been Floridas dirty BIG secret, swept under the rug to protect the tourist industry. The CDC has finally started to investigate the harmful effects and the links to Alzheimer‚Äôs, ALS and non-alcoholic liver disease from these toxins which have been found airborne, as far as, 10 miles away from their source. The 11 tons of carnage removed from southwest Florida beaches in 2018 was horrific, it is finally being acknowledged. Hallelujah Fox News! Send the water South out of Okeechobee. Stop the spraying. Marine lives matter. Human lives matter.
They let the Liberals in the water again didn't they?
I‚Äôve been wanting to go to the beach all week, but red tide is still active. I believe we are in for a summer of it. Sad.

Bottom line, just as in the southwest, the ecosystem can not sustain the population. For decades Florida's industries and municipalities dumped tremendous quantities o waste and fertilizers into the Gulf.  The infrastructure in FL can not handle the population boom. The Everglades and Keys have been degrading for decades
